We will never go back again, service terrible and the food was just ok,,, it was a dirty place. Service was horrible - nothing to drink while our appetizer came, we had no silverware or napkin to use until after twenty min. I asked a hostess for utensils. I do think our server was over worked so I did tip well. I observed many employees talking and joking around and our server and another guy looked like they were trying to do all the work. We got one refill for tea the entire time - we were there almost two hours just to eat dinner. Ridiculous!

My husband I come to this location at least 4-6 times a year.  Their signature smoked sirloin and house dressing are so delicious! The staff is always accommodating and the meals are pretty large and affordable.

I will be the first to admit I'd never choose a steakhouse, but while in Charlotte on NASCAR business, this was the chosen place.  I am not a huge steak eater do I teetered between the seafood options. All sounded amazing, but I went with the salmon. It had a delicious smokey flavor, however it was slightly overcooked and not as flakey as I like. The bread was warm, crusty and very good.   I ordered an IPA (huge beer snob) and was delivered some type of wheat. I didn't have the heart to send it back because the service was superb. All three servers helping us were sweet and attentive.   Everyone in our party of 18 seemed to enjoy the food and most plates were clean.    While this is not at all my jam, it was a nice dinner with the team.

Worst dining experience of my life. The service was slow and every member of the staff seemed more incompetent than the last. Our poor waitress was obviously doing her best but there was an obvious lack of training. The dim witted bartender even put ice in my beer. That's when it crossed the line from merely bad to spectacularly disappointing.

We were searching for a steakhouse for my boyfriend's birthday, and after seeing how long the wait was at Texas Roadhouse, we decided to give this place a shot.  We were NOT disappointed.  They bring you out soft, round rolls with whipped butter.  They were hot, fresh, and delicious.  We got the crab cakes appetizer, and although we thought they would be bigger judging by the menu picture, they were still amazing.  The aioli sauce they were served with was a great complement.  I was pretty impressed that you have a choice of 3 side salads- house, Caesar, or wedge.  The wedge did not disappoint.  It was loaded with blue cheese & bacon.  My boyfriend got the Caesar, and also loved it.  For our entrees, I got the Ribeye encrusted in peppercorn, and topped with creamy sauce.  It was full of flavor.  He got the top sirloin and also loved it.  We were impressed that our steaks were cooked to the perfect temp.   Our server, Shawn, was very attentive.  We never had an empty drink.  Overall, a great experience.  $60 for 2 (no alcohol) is pretty great for a steakhouse. We will definitely be back.
Went for lunch on a Tuesday.    Not crowded but service was horribly slow.   Ordered Cajon burger.   It was very undercooked.    Doubt I will patronize again anytime soon.

I think that some of the bad reviews were a mistake on the reviewer's posting to the incorrect restaurant. There are two restaurants in the area that start with Texas. I don't think this one even has soup.   Our experience was great. Good service, good food, good atmosphere. All in all, everything tasted great! No complaints.  My nine year old insisted we set the record straight with a 5 star rating!

Musky smell ! Soon as we walked in !!! Carpet needs replacing bad !! Hostess walked to our table and laid the menus down and walked away never acknowledged us or said our servers name or would see us soon! Waitress was real nice and had good eye contact and was pleasantly nice and made some good suggestions  I had the so called smoked steak !!! Which was prime rib slow smoked and sliced in a good amount !but was cold even after they made another order which would have been better going back to the grill for 5 mins asparagus wasn't cooked to perfection and made it perfect the second time with a new so called smoked steak again which was in same order  Had them just not worry about but waitress insisted I try the sirloin cooked my way medium rare , which I. Fact came back well done needlessly to say I would rather them Not charge me for my half of the meal!!! But instead try something I didn't want so I doubt I will be going back again .

Stopped in for a drink and appetizer. After someone helped us the drink I order was wrong. Definitely was not Kettle One that I ordered. Told manager and they blew it off and did not offer anything else.

Garbage food - even by chain restaurant standards.  Check was incorrect, food was cold and the whole place needs a good cleaning.   My sandwich had obviously fallen off the plate and was hastily reassembled between kitchen and table.  Fries are Ore Ida at best.  Crab cakes were fishy, small and lukewarm.  Too many other choices to bother with Texas Land and Cattle.

Smoked Sirloin! Hands down the best smoked meat I have ever eaten.  The portions were huge and the price very good.  Service was quick and friendly.  If you can get by here make sure you stop.  It will be well worth the trip!

Ordered the large sampler platter and got a tray with mostly tortilla chips, a small bowl of spinach artichoke dip, 2 small chicken tenders, 4 small jalapeno pipes and 2 small portions of (total 8 very thin) ribs that were too tough to chew and were left unbeaten for $35! boo. Then, we waited forever for our food, only for it to be so awful, as hungry as we were, none of us could eat much of it. Awful experience.

The place is practically empty and we've waited 20 min for food.  Then it arrives and the meat looks like it spent 2 min on the grill. Steak salad but they forgot the dressing. There is no genuine effort to put out a good plate. Not impressed

Was with the wife at the mall and we decided we were in the mood for a steak lunch.  We had the ribeye and the brisket sandwich. Both were ok.   The first inpression is not very good either. As you walk in, the first thing you notice is a smell, characteristic of old places. Musky, with a tad of humidity.  Overall, an ok place. Nothing great. Definetively better options out there.

First time here. Wonderful service and food !  We sat in the bar area and the bartender was fantastic and running her tail off!  She was nice, super service and happy. Very refreshing !  My steak did come out over cooked but the manager had them cook another one immediately and it was melt in my mouth perfect!  Highly recommend this place and we will be back.

Sept 11:  Wanted a steak for dinner. This place came up with some good reviews. Was hesitant because of another review two days ago about a really bad smell. So when we get there, we are seated right by the door. It's 5:30 and the place is NOT busy. With two families we ask for a table in the back. So the host brings us back to a booth. Not a table, so whatever. We get seated and the host comes back later with straws and says or waiter will be with us shortly. Six min later the waiter comes and gets our drinks. He comes back a couple min later with bread and the two beers. No water for the other four. Finally get our order of appetizer and meals. Salads come quick. Appetizers finally show with our meals. I ordered the top sirloin done medium. My plate came out with a medium well. Should have ordered it med rare. Other couple ordered the house steak which was really good. Good smokey flavor. At the end our bill was wrong and mixed up between the two tickets so we had to wait a while for our waiter to correct it. All in all it was an ok place.
Ate here while visiting the Great Wolf Lodge! The smoked sirloin was recommended and was a WINNER. Kid friendly, great experience in the Concord area!

One of my favorite steak houses. I prefer my steak cooked on the rare side and they nailed it perfectly. Our entire meal was perfect. Our waiter was polite and courteous. He was attentive to our dining needs. I would recommend eating here. Prices aren't as bad as I have read in other reviews. They are very reasonable for the dining experience.

Food was average, beer on tap was warm, service, while friendly, was ridiculously slow for 3:30 on a Friday with 2 other tables occupied.  Highlight was the fried pickle appetizer...perfectly fried with great dipping sauce.  Lowlight, other than snail service, was the steak nachos, which was actually like 10 chips topped with a little cheese & a cube of steak.  Burgers were average & fries were not hot.  Ludicrous 30% tip added to bill!  If I'm going to waste 2 hours of my life and $200 (party of 5), I better be wowed...and I wasn't.

We recently held a large dinner for clients at this restaurant. The service was pretty good considering how large of a group it was. The food was excellent. The atmosphere was nice and casual. I was surprised to find that the women's bathroom did not have any toilet seat covers. If I am in town again and need to host a dinner I will definitely be considering this place.

Just ok. I came here to Charlotte for work and nearby was this steakhouse. I would say the inside is nice, has a typical steak chain ambiance like Outback or Longhorns.  I had the Shrimp & Grits with a side of asparagus. I wasn't into ordering the steak but the group I went with ordered it and liked it. If you're a vegetarian, there are some salads or veggie options too. Limited but available.   if you're staying here I would say worth a try since it is better than TGIF or Jack and the Box. Yikes!

Delicious!  I got the 9oz top sirloin steak with a side salad & fresh green beans. The flavor on the steak was excellent & the meat was tender. My mom got the same thing & said it was good. Mt dad got the salmon & said it was some of the best he's ever had. Service was fast & the chef even came out to check the meal was prepared correctly. Over all I'm impressed.  It's not like the typical chain steak restaurant.
